rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {0099, 1759, 2677, 3900}

description: This elective unit introduces the students to a broad range of common dermatological problems encountered in the general practice setting, requiring them to engage with clinically relevant and up-to-date information on topics such as patterns and diagnosis of skin disease, erythematopapulosquamous diseases, dermal and subcutaneous problems, skin tumours and pigmented lesions and skin infections. Topics are written in conjunction with content specialists practising in these areas, and are customised specifically for the general practice setting.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
